question: Yes?
answer: Hi, Edna Powers? I'm Patience Price, I called about adopting a cat? I saw your flyer at my vet's office --

question: Oh yes, do come inside. EDNA undoes the chain, opens the door for her.
answer: ... Ma'am? EDNA is putting out DRY CAT FOOD in numerous BOWLS.

question: You may call me Edna.
answer: Edna. Some of these questions are... kind of personal. Do you really need to know how many, um, partners I've had in the past year?

question: I'm not interested in your love life. But I do want to know what sort of home environment you're offering, your degree of commitment...
answer: Guess I wouldn't need the cat if... Patience forces a laugh, fills in a ZERO and passes the clipboard to EDNA. The woman puts down the cat food, slips on the reading glasses she wears on a chain around her neck.

question: The application is mostly a formality. I have a sense about people.
answer: Well, I've always liked animals. Cats specifically. I mean, I love them... worship them, even. EDNA seems satisfied, returns to reading Patience's answers. THE MAU, meanwhile, comes around a corner into the room, peering curiously at Patience -- who dangles her hand invitingly. He rubs his face against her hand. PATIENCE smiles, coos at the cat -- which grabs her hand hard in his CLAWS. PATIENCE stifles a yelp, yanks her hand back. Son of a --

question: Excuse me?
answer: Nothing... handsome cat. I've never seen one like him. THE MAU jumps into Patience's lap, settling in. Edna, surprised and almost suspicious, eyes the cat.

question: Her. That's Midnight, an Egyptian Mau. Normally she doesn't trust people -- EDNA reaches a hand toward MIDNIGHT -- the cat's fur stands up, she HISSES and SWIPES at Edna. See? Even I can't get near her... Very strange. So. You left out your parents' address.
answer: Well... they're both dead.

question: No hereditary illnesses, I hope.
answer: Private plane crash. I was eleven. Actually, the last thing they gave me was a kitten... Fatso. EDNA sucks her breath in at this insulting name. He was very round -- not from overfeeding or anything, just -- really, he didn't mind. Anyway, he was with me a long time, till early this year. He didn't come at the sound of the can-opener, which kind of freaked me out... I found him just, curled up there in his little bed...

question: It's very hard, dear, I know... you must be in so much pain. Midnight digs her long NAILS into Patience's thigh, kneading. PATIENCE winces, tries to dislodge cat's claws from her leg -- Midnight "playfully" attacks her hand. Stifling a gasp:
answer: Mm-hmm.

question: Funny how cats get under our skin. They do exactly as they please, they don't care what anyone thinks about them... they're the ultimate predators. So self-contained, so independent, so wild... sometimes I wonder, why do they even put up with us?
answer: The free food?

question: Well, congratulations. It seems you've been chosen.
answer: So you think you might have a kitten for me...?

question: Kitten? No, that wouldn't be appropriate. Midnight has chosen you. It's a great honor. Maus are a very rare breed, descended from the sacred cats of ancient Egypt. They were believed to have magical gifts.
answer: I'm not sure she likes me --

question: Nonsense, she perceives something very special in you.
answer: There's nothing special about me.

question: Cats see things we don't. Our secret selves -- our souls.
answer: Mm. Do you have any Band-Aids?

question: No -- this is mine! MIDNIGHT doesn't back off, jumping repeatedly at the spoon, climbing over Patience, getting a rear PAW in the open pint. Oh, gross, you -- just take it. Patience offers the cat the half-empty pint. As MIDNIGHT digs in happily, burying his head in the container -- Welcome home, sweetie. How was work today...? Same old same old. All I wanna do is get out of this shirt and give you a big old hug... LONE is distracted, reading his mail, shirt still on. MIDNIGHT, meanwhile, pulls her head out of the ice cream and leaps onto the windowsill -- she looks first at Lone, then at Patience, who looks around her. Down in front... Come on, you, off with the shirt. Instead, LONE is moving out of view. PATIENCE moves in the same direction, into her BATHROOM. Lame, lame, lame. She wipes a bit of chocolate from the corner of her mouth. She tries a seductive pout, a la Laurel, gives her hair a seductive toss -- it winds up in her eyes and mouth. ON PATIENCE'S WINDOW -- from across the alley, we see PATIENCE before her mirror, brushing her hair. PULL BACK to reveal we're watching with TOM LONE, who spies on Patience through his own window, lights off. He SIGHS.
answer: Look what the cat dragged in.

question: I know, I know, I'm late -- Midnight thought there was a mouse in my pillow.
answer: This is why I only sleep with my own species. Lunch at Joey's? PATIENCE nods and waves as she hurries through a set of doors to an ELEVATOR BANK.

question: Oh honey, welcome back! She throws her arms around Georges to give him a kiss, but he pushes her away, turns aside to SNEEZE. Are you all right?
answer: My allergies. I thought you were getting rid of that vile dog of yours. GEORGES plucks a long DOG HAIR from her clothes, holds it up for her to see, then moves on briskly, down an external flight of stairs from the helipad to a PENTHOUSE below. Laurel follows after him, Angel in the rear.

question: Georges, when you're gone, Tippy is all I've got and -- I get so lonely.
answer: So get a bird or a fish, something that doesn't shed. Have you gained weight? They head through glass doors into the PENTHOUSE.

question: No no, it's muscle -- I've been working out, doing my Tae Kwan Do -- She flexes a MUSCLE to demonstrate. GEORGES isn't interested, looking at the penthouse decor with distaste. Meanwhile ANGEL moves to an elevator, presses a down button and awaits his masters.
answer: What the hell happened here?

question: I'm doing some redecorating, I've had so much time on my hands -- do you like it?
answer: No. What's with the curtains?

question: Draperies. They soften the space...
answer: I like hard spaces. Whatever, Laurel, if it makes you happy. I plan to be spending more time at the factory, anyway. He enters the ELEVATOR, Laurel behind, Angel hits the button. In or out? PATIENCE meekly steps into the elevator, presses a button for the lobby, nervously keeping her eyes fixed to the front. Excuse me, miss. Do you know who I am?

question: I like hard spaces. Whatever, Laurel, if it makes you happy. I plan to be spending more time at the factory, anyway. He enters the ELEVATOR, Laurel behind, Angel hits the button. In or out? PATIENCE meekly steps into the elevator, presses a button for the lobby, nervously keeping her eyes fixed to the front. Excuse me, miss. Do you know who I am?
answer: Um... of course. You're Georges Avenal -- you own the company --

question: Then you actually work for me. Are you familiar with our products?
answer: Yes sir, I just can't really afford them --

question: What's your name?
answer: Patience...

question: I haven't got all day --
answer: No, my name's Patience, Patience Price. I'm in accounting.

question: I'm afraid that's no excuse. Regardless of your position, you do represent Avenal Beauty. I simply can't allow that to continue.
answer: Wait. You're not -- firing me?

question: I try, Sally, I really do. I read Vogue, I wear uncomfortable shoes... I've been a female all my life, you'd think I'd be better at it by now.
answer: Watch the frown lines, you'll need a lift before you're forty.

question: He's right, I'm not even presentable enough to be an accountant. Maybe the church needs a new bell- ringer.
answer: Look, he was just in a bad mood. Sales are down, his marriage is on the rocks --

question: How do you know that?
answer: I have an enquiring mind. This is "Nympho," very hot, I snagged it from the showroom... She opens a tube of LIPSTICK, starts applying it expertly to Patience's lips as she speaks. Laurel's losing her looks, she's dumber than her cockapoo -- buzz is, Georges is trading her in for next year's model. All I'm saying is, by now he's probably forgotten about canning you.

question: I don't care. No way am I going back there.
answer: Shut up, you'll smear... voila, now suck your finger. Patience puts her finger in her mouth, pulls it out with a pop, to keep the lipstick off her teeth. She studies the residue on her finger.

question: I can't believe we put this stuff on our mouths. Grease, acid and ground-up fish scales... who knows what they put in our mascara...
answer: No wonder you never made it in sales. ANGLE THROUGH WINDOW BEHIND THEM, as a long LIMOUSINE passes.

question: These look good, Wesley, send them back to the agency. LAUREL closes the compact, leans across to catch a glimpse.
answer: May I see?

question: You wouldn't be interested.
answer: Please, Georges? She tugs a board away, then sucks in her breath seeing -- AN AD featuring DRINA, a gorgeous young model, nearly nude. We see a tube of MASCARA with the AVENAL LOGO.

question: That's Drina.
answer: She's... pretty.

question: She's magnificent. GEORGES takes the board back, LAUREL looks a little sick.
answer: Well, I'm still the face of Avenal... aren't I?

question: You've had a remarkably long shelf life, it's true. But... every product has an expiration date. Laurel bites her lip, looks out the window, close to tears. A PHONE is ringing, ANGEL answers in front. Georges' hands are still full with the ads piled around him.
answer: Uh, sir, it's Dave Berger in accounting.

question: Who? I don't talk to bean-counters.
answer: He says it's urgent.

question: All right, Angel, put it on speaker.
answer: Mr. Avenal -- I hate to bother you, sir, but we have a problem. It seems the lab has been overproducing YP-3 -- that's the anti-aging ingredient in Beaunique --

question: Why are you telling me this? It's routine to have a surplus --
answer: We've stockpiled over a thousand gallons, enough to last us well into the 29th Century.

question: Perhaps that is a trifle optimistic --
answer: And very expensive. Funding seems to have been siphoned out of the employee pension plan --

question: Impossible, this has to be an error. Are you responsible for this data?
answer: Well, actually Patience Price brought the matter to my attention --

question: Yes, yes, I'm familiar with Ms. Price. Obviously her bookkeeping is as sloppy as her appearance.
answer: Sir, she's a very reliable employee --

question: I've heard enough, Berger. In the future, double- check your figures before you waste my time -- and then put it in a memo.
answer: In all fairness, Mr. Avenal, I think --

question: Wow... sorry, Patience, I just found a new best friend. PATIENCE, beside her, WHISTLES appreciatively, then moves on.
answer: I'm sick of drooling over things I'll never have. The two are WINDOW-SHOPPING, passing a SHOE STORE, boots and high-heels... A WESTERNWEAR SHOP, belt buckles, WHIPS...

question: Oh, you're a ray of sunshine. Tell you what, let me take you clubbing this weekend --
answer: I'm not sure I'm fit to be seen in public.

question: You will be in that dress. I've had my eye on it for weeks. SALLY points at a MANNEQUIN in the window of a trendy boutique, garbed in a dramatic, sexy outfit -- a short bodice, a tiny skirt, plenty of plastic skin showing.
answer: Sally, that is not a dress, it's a rumor of a dress. It's barely forensic evidence of a dress.

question: It's a genuine Gaultier knock-off --
answer: It's not me.

question: But don't you ever wanna be somebody else?
answer: I just wish I could be ten years old again -- it didn't matter what I wore as long as I could climb a tree in it.

question: Your tomboy days are over.
answer: That's my bus, Sal, see you later. PATIENCE trots toward a BUS, SALLY calls after her.

question: This weekend, Patience. I swear, I'm gonna make you have fun if it kills you... As Sally moves on, CAMERA LINGERS ON the window of A LINGERIE STORE, scantily-clad MANNEQUINS, including one in BLACK UNDIES and a CAT MASK.
answer: Midnight! You little monster -- Patience tosses her groceries in the door, leaving it ajar, and runs after the cat. A few moments after she's vanished up the stairs, we hear FOOTSTEPS from below and... ANGEL, Georges Avenal's menacing bodyguard, appears in the hallway. He moves purposefully for Patience's door, pushes it open and steps inside. Midnight just saved her neck. Oh no... Hell of a jump... You are not worth the trouble -- Suddenly, a WINDOW FLIES OPEN, just a foot away, a GUN points in her face. Patience lets out a CRY, jumps back --

question: Midnight! You little monster -- Patience tosses her groceries in the door, leaving it ajar, and runs after the cat. A few moments after she's vanished up the stairs, we hear FOOTSTEPS from below and... ANGEL, Georges Avenal's menacing bodyguard, appears in the hallway. He moves purposefully for Patience's door, pushes it open and steps inside. Midnight just saved her neck. Oh no... Hell of a jump... You are not worth the trouble -- Suddenly, a WINDOW FLIES OPEN, just a foot away, a GUN points in her face. Patience lets out a CRY, jumps back --
answer: Freeze! It's TOM LONE. But Patience loses her balance, FALLS -- -- and LANDS in an open DUMPSTER. LONE darts from the window, alarmed, realizing his error. You all right? He clambers onto the dumpster's edge to help her out, she slips and slides, almost pulls him in after her. I'm really sorry -- I'm a police officer, I heard the noise and just assumed... here, grab my arm. He manages to hoist Patience to the lip, she's able to climb to the ground. She's drenched in GOOEY GARBAGE, just stares at Lone, a bit dazed from the fall. She can't believe she's face to face with the man of her dreams. Lone thinks a beat. Habla espanol?

question: No, I -- see, my cat got out -- MIDNIGHT MEWS, rubs against Patience's leg. She picks the cat up, nods toward her window. I live right up there --
answer: I know.

question: You do?
answer: I mean, I -- I've seen you. Around.

question: Really. Actually, I've seen you too. Around, that is. Thanks for helping me out.
answer: Don't mention it. I can't resist a damsel in distress. PATIENCE smiles and cocks her head... flirtatious body language. She runs a hand through her hair, pulls out some sticky TISSUE PAPER, looks at it with disgust.

question: Oh God, what -- what is that?!
answer: I could run it over to the lab... She tosses it in the dumpster, finally registering that she's drenched in WET GARBAGE.

question: I'm sorry, it was nice talking to you, but -- I'm completely disgusting. It isn't funny.
answer: Yes it is. All this time you've spent mooning over that hottie neighbor and he points a gun at you --

question: At least it broke the ice --
answer: I told you men go for trashy women. Patience rolls her eyes, looks over Sally's clothes.

question: Speaking of which -- how do you even stay in that outfit?
answer: With any luck, I won't need to.

question: I hardly recognize you.
answer: That's the idea. I go out at night, I leave daytime Sally behind, become a different person. All women do. Except you, of course.

question: How long have we been here, an hour? We're never getting in... A TRENDY COUPLE -- call them RANDY and SANDY -- push their way past PATIENCE, almost knocking her over. Randy's ELBOW gets her in the gut, Sandy's SPIKE HEEL drives into her foot. Ow! SANDY looks at her blankly as PATIENCE hops, injured. You could say I'm sorry? God, people are so rude.
answer: Yes! Sally has just gotten the NOD, hurries forward. Patience follows, limping a bit. The BOUNCER blocks Patience's path, looking her over from head to toe, disapproving. She's with me. She happens to be a very fine human being --

question: Sally, just -- go in without me --
answer: See, you shoulda bought the dress. PATIENCE bolts, humiliated; SALLY looks after her sadly.

question: Midnight? What are you doing here? She squints, sees morning light through a window. She climbs out of bed in her nightdress. You can't change their nature. The neighbor scowls and returns to her weeding. As EDNA bends down for her newspaper, she hears a MEOW and sees -- -- Midnight licking a HAND, which protrudes from under a bush. Edna GASPS, moves closer, crouching to get a better look. It's PATIENCE, sound asleep, body twisted sideways in an unnatural position. Quietly: Hello...? What are you doing in my hedge? Patience rolls out from under the bushes, crouches on her haunches now, a panicky look in her eyes. Leaves and dirt cling to her clothes. She has no idea how she got here. Your name is Patience Price, you live on South 87th. You love chocolate -- you're afraid of heights? Any of this ring a bell? Patience nods slowly, puts her face in her hands.
answer: I... it's coming back to me. But last night... it's just... it's like a dream.

question: You said in your application that you don't drink or take drugs.
answer: I don't. I think... something must have happened. I need to...

question: You need to rest. Patience takes a few steps from the couch and lets the blanket slip from her shoulders. Oh my God... Edna stares at PATIENCE'S BACK. The fabric of her dress is torn, the skin discolored beneath with a hint of dried blood -- and we make out the marks left by a TIRE TREAD. You're in no condition to -- EDNA moves beside Patience and GRABS HER by the wrist -- ON PATIENCE'S HAND, the fingers CURL and FIVE SHARP CAT CLAWS emerge from her fingertips -- only for an instant. EDNA blinks at this, PATIENCE whirls on her with an abrupt and frightening HISS -- CLOSE, Patience's pupils become ELLIPTICAL for a blink, flecked with GOLD, then -- She yanks her hand away quickly, immediately looks contrite, and a bit dazed from the momentary transformation.
answer: Sorry, you -- you startled me... look, Edna, thanks for everything, but -- I just want to get home and take a bath. Edna nods, unnerved. PATIENCE picks MIDNIGHT up in her arms and hurries out the door. Edna stares after her, a disturbing thought forming.

question: I am so, so sorry -- TOM LONE groans, painfully coming to and sitting up. PATIENCE crouches at his side.
answer: You actually hit me with a frying pan?

question: I didn't know it was you.
answer: Guess we're even now. Name's Tom Lone, by the way.

question: Patience Price.
answer: Yeah, I know, I checked your ID.

question: Oh God, not that awful driver's license picture --
answer: Got any ice? I found your purse in the street right outside this morning. I tried calling -- I was afraid something might've happened to you... PATIENCE returns with a washcloth full of ice.

question: That was really nice of you.
answer: Well, it's part of my job... I'm a detective, burglary-robbery division. So what did happen to you? He applies the ice-pack to his head while eying her clothes. She suddenly becomes aware of her disheveled appearance.

question: Oh no, I'm a mess. It seems every time you see me I -- I was just cleaning. The um, the chimney.
answer: Where's the fireplace?

question: It wasn't mine.
answer: You're a freelance chimney sweep? LONE is now looking around the apartment, taking it all in with a careful detective's eye. He sees the shredded PHOTOGRAPHS, the BROKEN WINDOW, points -- You should get that fixed.

question: Oh yeah, I hadn't noticed... I mean, I had to break it to get in because... I lost my purse.
answer: Funny, looks like it was broken from inside. Lone is now regarding her with open curiosity. Patience shrugs helplessly. So everything's all right now? Well, I'd better be getting to the station, then... unless there's anything else. LONE hopes so, PATIENCE desperately wants him to stay... but

question: I guess not...
answer: Then -- bye, now. He sounds disappointed. As the door shuts, Patience clutches her hair, makes a SOUND of frustration, almost like a MEOW.

question: I want you... He turns, startled. Patience has a sultry, come-hither look in her eye, her VOICE has a lower, sexier tone.
answer: Excuse me? She shudders. The sexy expression turns to one of shock and anxiety -- what has she done? Then, vamping:

question: I want you, um, to forgive me. For hitting you like that.
answer: No need -- woman living alone, you can't take any chances. Listen, I was gonna grab a cup of coffee...

question: So, did you always want to be a policeman? God, listen to me, Conversation 101.
answer: Hey, we gotta start somewhere. Actually, when I was a kid, I wanted to be a rock star. They take seats at a small table. I was kind of a delinquent back then, got into some trouble. There was a cop who helped me out. Made a difference. I figured... maybe I could do the same.

question: Plus you can still get into trouble.
answer: Right, but for the good guys... So what do you do? When you're not dumpster diving or cleaning chimneys, I mean.

question: Accounting. That is, I used to, I just lost my job.
answer: I'm sorry.

question: Don't be, it was pretty dull. I guess when you get down to it, I'm pretty dull. Patience realizes she's not making for a great first date. Let me start over. It's just... I never got into any trouble or anything --
answer: Come on, never?

question: Well, when I was little, but -- after I lost my folks I... I guess I turned into sort of a scaredy- ca -- um, pretty risk-averse.
answer: That's not a bad thing. It's a pretty dangerous world.

question: Sometimes I just wish I was less of a wimp.
answer: You're not afraid to admit you're afraid -- that takes guts.

question: It does?
answer: Most women I know pretend to be tougher than they really are. Listen... if you ever need someone -- to look out for you, keep an eye on -- -- or whatever -- I'm available. He pulls a card from his wallet, passes it to her.

question: Wow.
answer: Oh hey, I didn't mean that to sound like a come-on

question: Oh.
answer: I mean, unless you... I'm just going to shut up now and go.

question: See you around.
answer: Yeah, you will. He gives her a wave and heads out of the coffee shop. A broad smile spreads over Patience's face.

question: Okay, with too much YP-3 you get side-effects -- but too much of anything is bad for you -- tap water, sunshine, cigarettes --
answer: It's like leprosy or something...

question: The point is, now that we've adjusted the formula, Beaunique works. Plumps the skin, removes wrinkles, leaves a nice rosy glow -- it's perfectly safe now, my own wife uses it... His voice trails off as he considers this fact. He glances at the medical pictures, puts them aside. Airy denial: You want to be beautiful, you've got to make certain sacrifices. I mean, look at Botox, women are lining up to get their faces paralyzed. NEVSKI has been doing a slow burn, now blurts out: What? You're not making sense -- I've never heard of the man. Doctor Nevski, is it possible you've gone insane? NEVSKI spins on his heel and storms out.
answer: Russians, sheesh.

question: And the cat came back, the very next day... MOVE UP SLOWLY to reveal the rest of the ensemble -- long legs in BLACK TIGHTS, the short SKIRT and bodice TOP of the dress. A WHIP is wrapped around her waist, the tip dangles almost like a tail. Her stride is confident, sexy. The cat came back, they thought she was a goner... Her arms are encased in long, satiny BLACK GLOVES. A half MASK with eyeholes and subtle cat's ears covers the top half of her face, her hair falls free like a mane behind. But the cat came back, she just wouldn't stay awa- a-ay... CATWOMAN -- the former PATIENCE PRICE -- comes to a stop in front of the slack-jawed BOUNCER. What's the word I'm looking for? Oh yes... Meow. So saying, she strokes a finger under the bouncer's chin -- CLOSE, the CLAW emerges from a SLIT in the glove's fingertip, but doesn't draw blood. THE BOUNCER recovers himself, unhooking the rope and stepping aside. Catwoman strides past him into the club. Buy me a drink. SANDY stares daggers at Catwoman with her drooling boyfriend, but Catwoman ignores her, leaning close to the attentive BARTENDER and almost whispering: White Russian, no ice, hold the vodka and Kahlua. The man blinks, retreats to fill the order. SANDY taps Catwoman on the shoulder as she makes eyes at Randy. Let's dance. She grabs RANDY by the lapel and drags him toward the dance floor -- not that he needs a lot of encouragement. CATWOMAN shoves the man onto the dance floor ahead of her. She begins to writhe sensuously to the music, instantly the center of attention. Catwoman's distinctive movements combine catlike grace with acrobatics and martial arts. Don't touch my tail. CATWOMAN pulls her WHIP from around her waist, FLICKS it in the air -- Randy backs off. But Catwoman swings the whip so that the braided leather wraps repeatedly around his torso. Guess the party's over. CATWOMAN springs upward, atop a BANK OF SPEAKERS. She moves with incredible agility, near the roof of the club, from the speakers to a LIGHT RIG -- she leaps and grabs a MIRROR BALL, which SWINGS and deposits her close to the door. C'mon in, wanna-bes! Free drinks! THE CROWD stampedes the door. Catwoman struts away down the sidewalk, recoiling the whip around her waist. Oooh, pretty. THE THREE THIEVES spin, looking around -- You boys -- thought you could just barge -- in here and take -- all these beautiful things -- that don't belong to you... The guard quickly tears off his GAG and BLINDFOLD, untying his own feet, then picks up the fallen handgun and trains it on the thieves. We hear POLICE SIRENS APPROACHING. CATWOMAN meanwhile swiftly gathers up fallen jewels, sweeping them into the swag bag. She pauses for a moment, thoughtful. What a lovely idea.
answer: Freeze! CATWOMAN freezes. She blinks down at LONE, he's got a clean shot at her. She cocks her head, licks her lips.

question: You are cute. LONE blinks at this uncommon response to a pointed weapon, continues to play it by the book.
answer: I'm a police officer!

question: Bet you look sweet in uniform. And such a big gun...
answer: I, I -- Come down here, now!

question: -- but this time, it was like the tiger wanted to kill me... MOVE TO FIND PATIENCE, seated at Edna's kitchen table, finishing her tale. She's in tight-fitting jeans, RIPPED along the sides, a cut-off top revealing her midriff. Safety pins hold the outfit together, but it looks good on her. EDNA is pulling out teacups, a TEAKETTLE on the burner.
answer: You were afraid -- you became its prey. The tiger shredded your clothes?

question: No, I did that myself. I mean, I remember doing it, but it wasn't really -- you know -- me. God, I don't understand what's happening.
answer: I'm not sure how to put this -- it may be hard for you to accept -- but I'm something of an expert in these matters --

question: What matters?
answer: Vampirism, lycanthropy... feligyny.

question: Um...
answer: Feles, Latin for cat. Gynos, Greek for female. I'm a professor of folklore and mythology -- that is, I used to be, until I was denied tenure. They said my work was frivolous, but it was an all-male department, and -- well, it's a long, sordid story

question: Edna, please. Can we talk about me?
answer: Oh, yes. The other night... I think you may have... had an accident. A very serious accident. Fatal.

question: But -- I'm not dead.
answer: Not anymore, dear. After you died, you were reborn. As a catwoman. A dramatic WHISTLE. EDNA takes the TEAKETTLE off the stove. Mint or chamomile? The cult of catwomen dates back to Ancient Egypt, where felines were first domesticated. A SMALL CAT suddenly LEAPS INTO FRAME, staring UP AT CAMERA. EDNA, in her reading glasses, and PATIENCE are seated before the research material spread on her desk, cups of tea before them. Edna patiently removes the CAT. Excuse me, Cicero. ON PAPERS -- a DRAWING of the TEMPLE OF BAST. The temple of the Catgod, Bast. A Persian army destroyed it in the fifth century BC. EDNA's tone is sad, as if this memory were fresh and painful. Legend has it that the priestesses became the first catwomen. The cats they'd worshipped -- Midnight's ancestors -- each gave up one of its nine lives to bring them back from the dead. ON A BOOK, images of MEDIEVAL WITCHES with their cats. In the middle ages, cats and catwomen were regarded as evil. Nonsense, of course, witches were just single, independent women who broke society's rules. EDNA passes Patience -- A BLACK AND WHITE print-out of a blurry SURVEILLANCE SHOT of SELENA KYLE, as seen in "Batman Returns." There were reports of a catwoman a while back on the East Coast -- like many, she turned to a life of crime -- but apparently she's disappeared or died.

question: How many have there been?
answer: No one can be sure. I've found references scattered through history, but catwomen tend to lead solitary, secretive lives. Hard to blame them, it seems most were murder victims. PATIENCE has heard enough. She rises, freaked out.

question: I was murdered? Why would anybody kill me? No, I never did anything to... I don't want to break the rules! She moves out of the room, Edna follows. She's like some demon, possessing me in the night, but -- but I can keep it under control during the day --
answer: Well, cats do sleep most of the day --

question: When she takes over -- it's like, she just does whatever she feels like, she doesn't care what people think --
answer: Is that so bad?

question: You don't understand -- I'm afraid she's going to hurt someone -- or get me killed. Again. PATIENCE is near tears. EDNA puts her arms around her. There's got to be a way to make it stop. Some kind of, I don't know, garlic or wolfsbane or something...
answer: A domestic cat can return to its natural state effortlessly. But once a cat's gone feral, it can never be tamed.

question: Okay... that isn't helping. EDNA pulls back, looks Patience in the eye.
answer: Relax a little, learn to live with your inner cat. Even love her -- she has many admirable qualities -- integrate her into your life. If you accept the darker impulses, try to channel them -- maybe she'll come to be domesticated --

question: No. I'm going to fight her. I'm stronger than she is --
answer: But you're only fighting yourself --

question: -- and I'm going to win. Patience heads out the door. Edna shakes her head; Patience isn't getting it.
answer: We've got to stop meeting like this. She spins to see TOM LONE approaching from his sedan, parked in a LOT off the alley. PATIENCE is wary of him now, but he seems casual, smiling. She glances at the dumpster anxiously, he follows her sight-line, snooping as always. Doing some spring cleaning?

question: Emptying the catbox, actually. LONE quickly takes a step back from the dumpster.
answer: So -- that was a... surprising message you left for me.

question: Oh, well, uh -- musta been my cold medication talking. She sniffles and coughs unconvincingly.
answer: Well anyway, if you still wanted to get together -- maybe we could get a bite to eat Friday night? PATIENCE pretends to think it over.

question: Tom Lone, Tom Lone, I called him on the phone -- now I won't be alone -- THE CAT isn't enjoying this, squeals and squirms free. Patience's smile fades a tick. It was Catwoman who made the call. What's he ever gonna see in me? MIDNIGHT has turned his butt to her, tail TWITCHING angrily. PATIENCE glances OUT THE WINDOW to glimpse -- LONE, who's just entering his apartment. PATIENCE quickly
answer: Patience, what are you doing here?

question: Just came by to clean out my desk.
answer: Hm. Did you dye --

question: What?
answer: -- your hair. You look different somehow. Cooler. Patience shakes her head, uneasy. Are you going to the funeral? I know, tinted contacts.

question: What funeral?
answer: You didn't know? Dave Berger, your boss -- his whole place blew up, gas explosion, the night you got fired.

question: Oh my God.
answer: Yeah, life's short, huh. The hottie neighbor! That glow, you're getting some, aren't you? Patience reaches the door to the elevators, waves Sally off and vanishes. Sally grins, figuring she's got it right.

question: Oh God, please -- please don't hurt me! CATWOMAN studies the frightened woman, easing her grip. Laurel drops the act, and with a martial arts SHRIEK drives a KNEE and a FIST into Catwoman in rapid succession -- CATWOMAN flies over the banister, grabbing a hold of the chandelier. It swings in the open foyer -- THE CHAIN creaks ominously, starts to rip from the ceiling -- CATWOMAN snaps the whip around an upper BALUSTRADE, just as - That was Venetian crystal, you bitch -- LAUREL launches a karate KICK at her, CATWOMAN deflects it, lands a blow of her own.
answer: A bitch is a dog. You're tougher than you look.

question: Took classes when I was modeling in Hong Kong. Damn it, I broke a nail. She's a skilled fighter, but CATWOMAN is faster, more nimble, able to avoid her attacks. Laurel suddenly pauses, looking winded, ready to give up the fight.
answer: Had enough?

question: Is that a Gaultier? Catwoman looks down at her clothes, giving Laurel the chance to grab a VASE OF FLOWERS, which she hurls at her -- IT SHATTERS, soaking Catwoman. She shakes off water.
answer: I hate water. Suddenly enraged, she lunges toward LAUREL, who hits the ground -- but CATWOMAN springs over her head, up to the landing where the LAPDOG yaps. She snatches it up by its collar, bares her CLAWS near its face. THE DOG shuts up, petrified.

question: No, please -- not Tippy!
answer: Where's your husband? A BEAT as Laurel takes this in. She lets out a little laugh.

question: Georges? Why didn't you say you wanted him in the first place? You one of his girlfriends? CATWOMAN springs back down, shoves Laurel against a wall, flexing her CLAWS.
answer: I don't belong to anybody.

question: Not my face, not my face!
answer: If I can't get to Georges, I can at least scratch up something he loves --

question: Georges doesn't love me! I don't know if he ever did --
answer: How sad. I'd cry if I cared.

question: He never took me seriously, I was just a, a trophy. And now he's bored, he found himself a new toy --
answer: I've heard this story before. Where is he?

question: He never comes home anymore -- I, I know he's got a box for the ballet Friday night --
answer: I can't wait that long. I want him now.

question: I swear I don't know where he is, he's left me! Oh God, my career is in the toilet, my whole life is over -- go ahead, tear me to pieces -- Wait... try the factory. I think that's where he meets Drano, his new mistress.
answer: I'll check it out.

question: What do you want with him, anyway?
answer: It's personal.

question: Are you going to kill him?
answer: Depends on my mood.

question: I'll pay you to kill him.
answer: And here I thought you were just some brain-dead mannequin --

question: I'll even give you a lift, if you'll let me watch -
answer: Sorry, I work alone. But I like your attitude.

question: Acquisitions --
answer: This is supply. There's been a slight complication, my employer wishes to move up the exchange -- tomorrow night.

question: Impossible -- there are issues of transport, available funds --
answer: We're willing to adjust the price. But if you can't pick up the goods tomorrow, we'll have to take our business elsewhere.

question: This isn't your first 'complication.' WESLEY unlocks a door to --
answer: It'll be eliminated, like the others. We just don't want to take any chances.

question: Just me --
answer: Oh my God. Our date...

question: Way to cover. Patience looks from Lone to the TV behind her --
answer: I -- I'll only be a minute. She quickly grabs some clothing, darts toward the bathroom. At the last moment she spots the CAT MASK on the floor and -- -- KICKS it UNDER THE COUCH as she moves into the bathroom. LONE steps inside, can see his apartment across the way. He calls through the half-open door as she changes:

question: By the way, last night -- you didn't happen to see or hear anything -- my apartment was broken into.
answer: No, sorry -- I never look out the window.

question: Weird, they didn't take anything, just broke a bottle of after-shave and slashed a picture of my sister. WITH PATIENCE, getting dressed. She smiles, delighted.
answer: Your sister, that's -- -- really a shame. LONE has moved to the kitchen table, where the numerous RESEARCH BOOKS and HANDWRITTEN NOTES are spread out. ANGLE ON BOOK -- A diagram of a BACTERIA, a drawing of a RAT, the entry "YERSINIA PESTIS."

question: What's Yersinia Pestis?
answer: Bubonic plague.

question: Bubonic plague? Why are you -- ? ON PATIENCE as she exits the bathroom, looking good.
answer: It's sort of a hobby of mine... She trails off, stopping in her tracks as she sees LONE, who's holding up her WHIP with a dubious expression. Oh, I had kind of a kinky boyfriend once. PATIENCE takes the whip and casually tosses it aside, but Lone's suspicions are fully aroused. Where should we eat?

question: I dunno... you like sushi? So what've you been up to lately?
answer: Me? Oh. Not much. You know, sitting around my apartment, watching television. As she speaks, she involuntarily BATS like a kitten at the swinging CURTAIN.

question: Really?
answer: Is that so hard to believe? What about you?

question: Catwoman. Patience starts, folds her hands in front of her. It's the case I've been working on.
answer: Oh yeah. I guess I heard about it.

question: I'm not surprised. Talk about your media circus.
answer: Well, she is interesting, isn't she? Kind of a... colorful character?

question: She's a thief and a killer.
answer: I don't believe that. I mean -- whatever happened to innocent until proven guilty? LONE seems a little taken aback at her vehemence. Just then, a JAPANESE WAITER places a HUGE TRAY OF SUSHI between them. Guess I went a little crazy ordering.

question: It's refreshing. A lot of women won't let a man see them eat.
answer: Right, then we go home and binge on Haagan-Dazs.

question: You do hide things, don't you. You may seem all sweet and shy, but you've got a secret wild side.
answer: Women in general, you mean.

question: Right. Women in general... You know, I actually saw Catwoman the other night. From a distance. Goofy costume.
answer: Really? I heard it was... sexy.

question: In a way.
answer: So it could be sexier... with what, maybe a wide belt?

question: Why so interested?
answer: You brought it up. LONE studies her for a few seconds. He seems on the verge of saying something important. But instead:

question: You want that toro? LONE is already reaching for another piece of sushi -- with lightning reflexes, PATIENCE grabs his hand to stop him -- he looks up at her, surprised. She backs off with a smile:
answer: No no, it's yours. She eyes the fish hungrily as he eats it.

question: Gonna have to get back to the station, I'm working nights.
answer: Catwoman again?

question: Afraid so. But I have a feeling she'll be in custody within the week.
answer: Why do you say that?

question: Individuals who feel compelled to act out through an animal alter-ego -- bats, birds, bugs, there have been a number of cases in other cities -- they catch themselves. Take too many risks, think they can play with the cops. See, they like to be watched... He's staring right at her now. Patience looks away. HER POV -- THE SUN GETTING LOW, vanishing behind a cloud. CLOSE, PATIENCE'S PUPILS become ELLIPTICAL for a blink. LONE pauses, standing close. Sorry. Seems like all I can do is talk about work. PATIENCE spins on him, a glint in her eye.
answer: So stop talking. So saying, she throws her arm around his neck, the other around his back, pulls him close for a KISS. Lone takes only a moment to respond -- it's a good one -- until -- CLOSE ON LONE'S BACK as her CLAWS involuntarily emerge, tearing right through his shirt and an inch down his back --

question: Ow! PATIENCE clutches her hands to her face, horrified at what she's done, starts backing away --
answer: I'm really sorry, I don't know what got into me, I -- I've got to go. She's on the run. A moment later, the surprised Lone pursues, rounding a corner...

question: Patience, wait -- But she's already vanished.
answer: It's happening, it's happening again. It's not even dark yet -- you said she could only come out at night!

question: It's happening, it's happening again. It's not even dark yet -- you said she could only come out at night!
answer: I didn't say that! Patience, you made these rules up yourself -- a cat is a cat 24 hours a day, they just go hunting at night --

question: And she's after Georges Avenal -- if she finds him, she's going to kill him, I know it --
answer: Stop talking about her like she's someone else! She's you! A beat -- Patience is in denial about this.

question: Edna, you've gotta... tie me up or something, lock me in the attic --
answer: I don't have an attic --

question: A closet, the pantry, something! Please... we have to keep the cat in tonight.
answer: Sure you don't need a blanket, dear? ON PATIENCE, at the foot of the stairs in this cold, dank space, hugging herself, rocking back and forth.

question: Just... lock... the door. Edna quickly CLOSES the door, throws a BOLT. It's extremely DARK down below. Patience starts to pace. We see her features contort with pain as she fights this interior battle. During this monologue, her voice becomes huskier, more Catwoman-like. I'm not a bad person... I'm not a killer... I'm not evil... not like Georges Aaavenal... His name becomes a harsh GROWL. She fights to get a grip. He's a murderer... he did this to me... it's all his fault.
answer: Midnight! Shoo! Midnight HISSES, but retreats sulkily. Edna reaches the nearly free bolt, is about to replace it and lock it when she hears a small, timid VOICE from below, through the door:

question: Edna? Edna, is that you?
answer: Yes, dear, I'm here.

question: Edna, it worked. I think... I think I've beaten her. I'm Patience again. I've won.
answer: Oh, I'm so glad... Edna looks terribly relieved as she throws aside the bolt and begins to open the cellar door. But before she can -- -- THE DOOR FLIES OPEN, knocking her off her feet. A FIGURE STREAKS PAST. We hear her voice as she retreats:

question: Those things'll kill you. She SMACKS the cigarette out of his hand, BOOTS him into the BUSHES and leaps on top of him. YP-3 -- the plague -- what's it for?
answer: I have no idea what you're -- BANG! She whams his head again.

question: Tell me about Xavier Bartok.
answer: How do you know -- She BANGS his head again.

question: I'm asking the questions.
answer: I -- I can't tell you -- She bares her CLAWS over his eyes.

question: Then it's time to brush up on your Braille.
answer: No, no, not my eyes! Xavier, he's the one who's buying the stuff!

question: When?
answer: The deal goes down tomorrow night -- at the Avenal offices --

question: Wrong. Your boss won't live to see it. She BANGS his head hard again, ANGEL loses consciousness. Thanks for your help.
answer: I knew you'd come. Laurel leads Catwoman through this basement boiler room. He's with his bimbo in a box to the right of the stage. But there's all kinds of security -- he's pretty scared of you.

question: He should be. How much do you know about your husband's operation?
answer: I know he's built an empire out of women's inadequacy and self-hatred --

question: Yeah, yeah, but the secret ingredient in his face cream -- it's black plague bacteria. He's selling it to an arms dealer.
answer: Oh my God...

question: And he's committed murder to protect his secret.
answer: Nothing he does would surprise me anymore. He's a monster. You should've seen the pre-nup, I don't get a dime -- CATWOMAN has reached an emergency STAIRCASE, cuts her off, bolting upward.

question: I'll take it from here. I love this part. GEORGES spins, startled -- and she SLASHES HIM across his cheek. The MUSIC is so loud, no one hears his CRY OF PAIN. GEORGES rushes for the exit -- but CATWOMAN gets there first, shoves a CHAIR under the doors. Let's not be interrupted. She advances on him, BLOOD drips from the SLASHES on his cheek, staining his tuxedo shirt. Red's a good color on you. At that, she grabs Georges and slams him against the wall of the box, behind a curtain, partly concealed from view. The DOOR RATTLES, increasingly hard. CLOSE as CATWOMAN wraps a hand around Georges' throat, the CLAW TIPS digging into his skin. He gasps:
answer: No -- please --

question: I could rip out your throat...
answer: Why -- why kill me?

question: Damn it. I can't. THE CHAIR SPLINTERS and the DOOR flies open, ARMED POLICE with DRINA behind them. CATWOMAN leaps to the lip of the box, turns and HISSES, then
answer: Freeze! You're under arrest -- He steps on a flimsy support, which starts to give way. Catwoman is alarmed.

question: Watch out! LONE sways, losing his balance, she springs and grabs his gun arm, saving him. A beat as they look at each other, then -- -- she SNATCHES the gun out of his hand, tosses it aside, then grabs his tie and pulls his face to her to LICK his cheek. Tag, you're it. She bounds away, comfortable on the narrow railings. Lone pursues, moving more carefully now. Accompanied by the ballet music, the two perform their private dance, high above the TOMBSTONES and GRAVES. CATWOMAN winds up in a corner on a MESH PLATFORM, no way out from here, but for a 25-foot drop to -- THE FLOOR, where POLICE await, pointing upward. LONE advances, he has her trapped. He pulls HANDCUFFS. Handcuffs. Yummy. He lunges at her -- she dodges, kicks a leg out from under him. No slouch at fighting, Lone recovers, plants a kick in her mid-section. She gasps, surprised. You play rough.
answer: This isn't a game. He charges at her, but she parries a blow, lands a SLASH across his shoulder. As he comes at her again, she jumps and grabs an overhead ELECTRICAL cable, swinging away -- Be careful! That thing hits the metal, we're both fried! CATWOMAN leans close, whispers:

question: I knew there was a spark between us. She turns and flings the cable away, it dangles free of the mesh floor, still spitting SPARKS. A second later, CLICK -- LONE has slapped a handcuff on her wrist, CLICKS the other cuff over his own. CATWOMAN spins back on him, looking hurt. He reaches to pull off her mask. She slaps his hand. Please, it's our first date. I wouldn't want the mystery to go out of our relationship. LONE struggles to push her off, but she keeps her thighs locked around him. He finally rolls on top of her.
answer: We don't have a relationship.

question: You men love the chase, but once you catch us, you always lose interest. As she speaks, CLOSE on her cuffed hand -- her fingers squeeze together, her hand slithers out of the cuff like a cat's paw. Sorry. She's on her feet, ready to scamper off, but -- MORE COPS have made it to the grid, blocking every way down -
answer: It's over.

question: And here I thought we were hitting it off... With that, she leaps and grabs the dangling POWER LINE which TEARS LOOSE from the ceiling -- She DROPS to the floor, still holding the CABLE. COPS surround her, moving in quickly, guns drawn -- She backs toward the wall, near a CIRCUIT BREAKER PANEL. Show of hands -- who can see in the dark? She lifts her own hand daintily, then violently SWINGS THE POWER CABLE into the CIRCUIT BREAKERS --
answer: Patience?

question: Not exactly. She throws herself on the end of the bed, curling up with the other cats, examining her injuries. She finds a bloody GASH where Angel's bullet grazed her skin. EDNA moves closer.
answer: Oh dear. You've been shot. Edna hurries into the bathroom and emerges with a small FIRST-AID KIT, begins tending to Catwoman's wound, still sniffling.

question: It's nothing to cry about.
answer: No, it's my cats. Last night, all that noise -- the neighbors complained. Animal Control says they're a health hazard...

question: Piss on 'em.
answer: They're coming tomorrow to take them away, have them destroyed --

question: It won't happen. I promise. EDNA studies Catwoman, speaks softly, worried.
answer: Did you do it? Did you kill him? CATWOMAN shakes her head, disgusted with herself.

question: I wanted to -- but I couldn't. I actually... felt sorry for him.
answer: Because you're still Patience Price.

question: Don't remind me. That girl is so weak.
answer: No, she isn't. You know that. Catwoman makes an exasperated noise, then YAWNS.

question: Patience. TOM LONE, wearing SUNGLASSES, approaches tentatively.
answer: Oh! Hi. Listen-- about last night...

question: Forget it. I, um... listen, I'm sorry about this. Patience Price, AKA Catwoman, you're under arrest. You have the right to remain silent... ON Patience's stunned expression --
answer: This is all a mistake -- Tom, you know me!

question: One thing you learn in this line of work -- you never really know anybody, not completely. You're being charged with vandalism, burglary and the murder of Doctor Ivan Nevski --
answer: He was dead when... um, Ivan who? You, you have no proof that I -- what are you doing? LONE is unbuttoning his shirt. He pulls down one side to reveal his shoulder.

question: These scratches were inflicted last night by Catwoman. Forensics also tested this scratch -- He turns around to show the claw-mark she left when they kissed. He turns to face her, rebuttoning his shirt. They were made by the same implement.
answer: So this whole time, you've been flirting, buying me dinner, acting like you were interested -- I was a suspect? It was just some cat and mouse thing? LONE's a little offended, his tone becomes more aggrieved:

question: No, not at first -- I really bought the act, vulnerable girl all alone in the big city --
answer: Sorry if I don't fit into your damsel in distress fantasy.

question: That's not what --
answer: Real people are a little more complicated.

question: Look, I didn't want to believe it, but --
answer: I guess a strong woman can be intimidating to a certain kind of man --

question: Did you really think I wasn't gonna recognize you in a little mask? I'm not blind.
answer: So if they don't need rescuing, you better lock them up yourself -- They're now talking over each other, sounding just like bickering lovers. LONE glances at the mirror, embarrassed; they're obviously being watched. Through his teeth:

question: Knock it off. It'll go a lot easier on you if you just confess now.
answer: I've been doing some investigating of my own. A real crime. Georges Avenal is stockpiling YP-3, a variant of black plague bacteria --

question: Oh yes, your little hobby. Please, Patience --
answer: It's a bioweapon! Ivan Nevski developed it, they must've killed him to keep it a secret --

question: So now you've constructed a paranoid fantasy with your former boss at the center. A disgruntled employee --
answer: The deal's going down tonight, they're meeting an arms dealer named Xavier Bartok at the Avenal offices --

question: You're hallucinating. Georges Avenal is world famous, worth millions, a respected businessman -- why in God's name would he get involved in arms trafficking?
answer: I don't know! Why don't you ask him?

question: Enough. Are you denying you're Catwoman?
answer: It doesn't matter what I say. You'll make me whoever you want me to be. LONE looks at her for a moment, then exits, leaving Patience to study her own defiant expression in the mirror. Damn it, it's getting dark out, where are you...? She stares at her hand, trying to will claws to appear -- nothing. A deep breath, concentrating, mantra-like -- I am Catwoman... I am... She opens her eyes -- it's no good.

question: Or one woman.
answer: Look what I found! All spin to see -- CATWOMAN standing at the edge of the helipad, above the sheer drop, holding THE TWO SUITCASES out to either side of her. She has a lit CIGAR clenched between her teeth. Behind her, the SKY is LIGHTENING with approaching dawn. ALL GUNS are trained on Catwoman, except Laurel's.

question: Don't shoot, you idiots! She'll drop the money-- They don't lower their guns. Catwoman narrows her eyes, speaks around the cigar.
answer: Henchmen, Laurel? How tacky.

question: No, please-- don't do that again! CATWOMAN drops the emptied case and pulls the cigar from her mouth with a distasteful expression. Eying Laurel:
answer: Don't you hate it when somebody shows up at a party wearing the same dress? LAUREL advances on Catwoman.

question: Let's face it -- we're alike, you and me. Catwoman ignores her, shouts to XAVIER and his men:
answer: You guys gotta be careful with this YP-3 stuff. It's a living thing, you know, a bacteria. If it gets too hot -- it dies. XAVIER looks from Catwoman to the FUEL pooling on the helipad, putting two and two together. He jerks his head at his mercs -- they start backing away toward the stairs. LAUREL is still focused on the money.

question: Let's split the rest of the money -- and there's more where that came from --
answer: Tempting offer... We would make a pretty good team. Beyond the law, fighting the yoke of male oppression, sisters under the skin... LAUREL nods hopefully. CATWOMAN looks thoughtfully at the cigar in her hand. Nah, I still have to live with myself. So saying, she flicks the LIT CIGAR to the helipad -- IGNITING the spreading pool of gasoline -- XAVIER ET AL. sprint to LEAP OFF THE HELIPAD or CHARGE DOWN THE STAIRS as -- THE HELICOPTER EXPLODES in a glorious FIREBALL. LAUREL is thrown across the helipad by the BLAST, showered with CHOPPER DEBRIS. The men are hightailing it out of there, but Laurel gets slowly to her feet, machine gun ready, bent on revenge. Spotting CATWOMAN darting through the SMOKE and FLAMES toward the stairs, LAUREL FIRES a volley with a SCREAM of rage and charges after her in pursuit.

question: Thank you.
answer: A promise is a promise. Her tone is soft, more like Patience's. EDNA takes in the blood on her, her torn clothes.

question: What happened to you?
answer: I found out the truth. Edna notes the SUNLIGHT pouring through the window, eyes her.
